body:
**Note:** `netlify-cms-proxy-server` runs an unauthenticated express server. As any client can send requests to the server, it should only be used for local development. Also note that `editorial_workflow` is not supported in this environment.

### [](https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/beta-features/#configure-the-netlify-cms-proxy-server-port-number)Configure the Netlify CMS proxy server port number

1. Create a `.env` file in the project's root folder and define the PORT you'd like the proxy server to use
title: Configure the Netlify CMS proxy server port number
excerpt: As any client can send requests to the server, it should only be used for local development. Also note that `editorial_workflow` is not supported in this environment.
author: Teslax
